bill.title: House Substitute for SB 280 by Committee on Taxation - Property tax; powers of taxing jurisdictions; valuation, appeals, procedure; ratio study, presentation to county commissioners; exemptions; bed and breakfasts; oil and gas leases, determination of value of production, evidence; county appraisers, persons eligible; market study analysis; tax liens, extinguishment; delinquent real property taxes, interest rates, claims against the county.
bill.description: House Substitute for SB 280 by Committee on Taxation - Property tax; powers of taxing jurisdictions; valuation, appeals, procedure; ratio study, presentation to county commissioners; exemptions; bed and breakfasts; oil and gas leases, determination of value of production, evidence; county appraisers, persons eligible; market study analysis; tax liens, extinguishment; delinquent real property taxes, interest rates, claims against the county.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Hearing: Tuesday, March 17, 2015, 9:30 AM Room 548-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Assessment and Taxation
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Taxation
House Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Federal and State Affairs
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Hutton
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Hutton was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed as amended
House Final Action - Substitute passed as amended;  Yea: 123 Nay: 0
Senate Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Senator Donovan , Senator Tyson and Senator Holland as conferees
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Barker,  Representative Macheers and  Representative Carmichael appointed as conferees
House  Representative Kleeb replaces  Representative Barker on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Suellentrop replaces  Representative Macheers on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Sawyer replaces  Representative Carmichael on the Conference Committee
House Conference committee report now available
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 122 Nay: 0
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Senator Donovan,  Senator Tyson and  Senator Holland appointed as second conferees
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Kleeb,  Representative Suellentrop and  Representative Sawyer appointed as second conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 122 Nay: 0
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 3(f) - 30 Minute Rule adopted
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Monday, May 09, 2016
Senate Vetoed by Governor; Returned to Senate on Tuesday, May 17, 2016
Senate Motion to override veto prevailed;  Yea: 39 Nay: 1
House Motion to override veto prevailed;  Yea: 120 Nay: 0

votes.desc: Senate Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Final Action - Substitute passed as amended - Yea: 123 Nay: 0
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 122 Nay: 0

Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
Senate Motion to override veto prevailed - Yea: 39 Nay: 1
